body: FWIW, our team has used the cancelation of contexts for graceful shutdown (e.g. wiring SIGTERM -> cancel()). It would be useful to have degrees of cancellation (e.g. STOP EVERYTHING NOW v. Stop when you can). That said, we tend to write crashsafe software, so when we want stop-everything-now, we usually don't want to rely on the application logic to implement that (and we just `kill -9` it).
